sense.def: Pathological Condition of jue 厥 , recession, brought about by liver qi transformed into wind. Su wen 素問 7: 二陽一陰發病，主驚駭背痛，善噫善欠，名曰風厥， “When the second yang and the first yin develop a disease, it is responsible for shock and back pain. [Patients] tend to belch; [patients] tend to yawn. This is called ‘ wind and recession ’”. WB commentary: 肝氣為風，腎氣陵逆，既風又厥， 故名風厥 , “Liver qi becomes wind. The kidney qi rises contrary to its proper direction. This, then, is a situation of wind [presence] and [kidney qi] recession. Hence this is called wind and recession ”.
